title: Ticket #7104: Custom resources sometimes not released from d-slot back to p-slot
description:
If a non-fungible custom resource has more than one entry with the same name, when the second or subsequent instance of the resource should be released back to a p-slot when a d-slot is destroyed, the release fails.

Subsequent attempts to create a d-slot using that resource will fail with the message 

    ERROR "Failed to bind local resource '%s'" at line %d in %s

For example if the following slot resources assignments exist 

startd classad fragments
Name = "Slot1"
SlotType = "Partitionable"
AssignedGPUs = "CUDA0,CUDA0"
GPUs = 0

Name = "Slot1_1"
SlotType = "Dynamic"
AssignedGPUs = "CUDA0"
GPUs = 1

Name = "Slot1_2"
SlotType = "Dynamic"
AssignedGPUs = "CUDA0"
GPUS = 1

And the STARTDs internal table of resource ownership will show 

CUDA0:1_1, CUDA0:1_2

When Slot1_2 is destroyed, the resource "CUDA0" will not be released back to the ownership of the p-slot - but the count of GPUs owned by the p-slot will still be updated. Only the first "CUDA0" will be released. So the situation will be 

startd classad fragments
Name = "Slot1"
SlotType = "Partitionable"
AssignedGPUs = "CUDA0,CUDA0"
GPUs = 2

And the STARTDs internal table of resource ownership will show 

CUDA0:1, CUDA0:1_2

Indicating that the p-slot owns 2 GPUS, but that the second "CUDA0" is assigned to slot1_2.

Thus, when we try and hand out the second "CUDA0" resource to a new dslot, the assignment will fail and the STARTD will abort.
remarks:
removal of the break is the fix, the rest is some D_FULLDEBUG logging to help diagnose problems in the future.
